Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is spotted with traces of a resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded in places, containing an account of wine.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.113)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36327) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36327)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 124 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
